intro: Buchenavia macahensis, commonly known as the Mexican elderberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Mexico and Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that develop into edible berries. Its botanical features include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and yellowish-white floral petals. The fruit is typically red or black when mature and is used in traditional medicine and culinary practices.
